PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Must have been fishing when these monsters came. Bad luck.

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Hm. Wouldn't wish that fate on anyone.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Fresh water. There must be a settlement somewhere nearby.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Let's hope the locals are friendly.

session_synopses.PAD_FightingFishers: Player clicked on a fisher's corpse on the beach that's near an intellect devourer's corpse, and remarks they must have put up a fight.
session_synopses.PAD_Jetty: Player comes near the end of a jetty that looks over the Chiontar.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: What's going on with that rune? Looks unstable somehow.
PAD_Approach.context:
NodeContext: 
Karlach: Fascinated, curious
Wary/a little curious

session_synopses.PAD_Approach: Player notices a strange magical emission coming from a waypoint rune - different from how they usually look.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You approach the dying monster. This is the thing that abducted you.*

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You could end its life here and now, if only you didn't feel...*

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: Bewildered. That was the last emotion you were expecting.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *The poor creature is on the brink of death, but there's still time.*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You'd give your life to save it, to nurse it back to health!*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *But then the feeling slips. The creature's mind seems to focus elsewhere.*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: With a bit of relief that the mind flayer's focus on you is abating.

Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Mindflayer.text: Take advantage of the lapse - break free.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *The monster lies exhausted, defeated. Its eyes - wet, orange pearls - radiate malice.*

VB_OtherSurvivors.speaker: Player
VB_OtherSurvivors.text: Footprints. There may be even more that survived the crash.

session_synopses.Mindflayer: The player approaches the dying mind flayer. During the dialog the player describes how the mind flayer still tries to telepathically dominate him or her into feeling compassion for the creature. In the end the player can give in to the mind flayer (which results in death) or resist.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeWoundedDevourers: You meet with some Intellect Devourers: walking brains essentially that are nasty creatures. They attack you. As non-gith you have no idea what these things are. As gith, you know very well.
session_synopses.VB_OtherSurvivors: The party remarks on seeing footprints.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Check yourself for injuries.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Other than the infection, you're more or less intact. A miracle, given everything you've been through.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances over themselves

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *But it'll all be for nothing if you don't find help soon.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Concerned expression

session_synopses: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

PAD_DeadGuide.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadGuide.text: The githyanki from the mind flayer ship. A shame he didn't survive.

session_synopses.PAD_DeadGuide: PAD for when players get closer to the alternative guide's corpse at the crash site. The guide is a gith mage the replaces Lae'zel in the tutorial introduction if Lae'zel is an avatar (he knows Lae'zel). After tutorial ends and players wake up, his corpse will appear nearby (he didn't get magically saved when falling).

ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Raise your palms to calm the boar.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Narrator
ScaredBoar.text: *The boar grunts and eyes you warily with its beady eyes.*

ScaredBoar.speaker: Player
ScaredBoar.text: Don't worry. I won't harm you.

ScaredBoar.speaker: Narrator
ScaredBoar.text: *The boar shuffles its trotters, unsure. Then it dashes away into the wilderness.*

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.
session_synopses.ScaredBoar: The player comes across a boar who's been panicked by the noise and confusion of nearby flying vessel crash. A speak with animals dialogue where the player can speak directly, or an animal handling moment where the player gains insight into the animal's temperament.

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: Of course it's dangerous. One of them carved up Zorru's whole squad.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And let the goblins have it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: No. We take it to the grove.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: Th-thank you. I couldn't have done it without you.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: But I've got to go. I need to check out that blast.

LaezelDead.speaker: Player
LaezelDead.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

AD_LaezelCombatComment.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelCombatComment.text: Let me down, and I'll show you true might!

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo1: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied2: Damays reacts to the death of nymessa at Lae'zel recruitment.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat2: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.LaezelDead: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)
session_synopses.AD_LaezelCombatComment: A random combat was dragged up to Lae'zel Recruitment (bandits, brains, etc.); Lae'zel is still in the cage. She says  this AD only once, after a player's turn.

PAD_Door.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Door.text: Won't get that open easily. Maybe there's another entrance.

session_synopses.PAD_Door: Shadowheart comments as a companion on another character trying to open the exterior door to Jergal's crypt.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Player
AD_OutsideStatue.text: Text is too faded. Doesn't tell me who was worshipped here.
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Players with religious classes comment on the plaque.

AD_SqueletonRoom.speaker: Player
AD_SqueletonRoom.text: I've never seen this language before. Who was worshipped here?
AD_SqueletonRoom.context: NodeContext: Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh. Reading a plaque in a slightly mocking tone before adding some displeased commentary.

session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.AD_SqueletonRoom: The player reads a bronze plaque at the feet of a mysterious statue

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: That you, Gimblebock? Everything all right out there?
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's reacting to them trying to open it and thinks they're his accomplice, a gnome called Gimblebock (ɡɪmbəl-bock)

EntranceDoor.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor.text: Gimblebock triggered some trap. He needs help - now!

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: Yeah? And who are you? Probably your trap that did him in...
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured by a trap. He's calling us out on the lie

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: Come through that door, and you're getting a knife in the guts.
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was harmed by a trap. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.text: You! Not another step, hear me?
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Sharp ultimatum mixed with a little surprise. Found the player approaching from the side of the structure.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view).NodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view)

BanditWestInteraction.text: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: What's this then - trying to creep around us and loot the crypt? Not happening.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: Or is it the ship you're after? Don't matter either way - it's ours, all of it.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.text: Lucky those bandits valued their own hides over their loot.

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.EntranceDoor:
This is the same character as Andorn, the bandit guard within the chapel.

This character is talking to the players through a door - he's locked the door and is on the other side, so they'll be talking TO the door and can't see him.

The player is talking to a gullible bandit through a door - the bandit is inside a chapel dungeon and his friends are outside. The player has probably either killed them or scared them away at this point. The guard is not very bright...
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.BanditWestInteraction: Alternate version of the confrontation scene between Gimblebock and his bandits at the crypt - triggers if the player approaches the scene from the side, alerting Warryn first.
session_synopses.VB_BanditsLeaveReaction: The player comments on how they talked the bandits into leaving (or companions react to the player's successful persuasion).
session_synopses.Bandit_Melee_01_Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart.text: Trying to frighten me with cheap tricks? Darkness is my element.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.JergalWandering: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1_WithShadowheart: The player just stole a relic of Selune and all candles around it extinct. Shadowheart reacts defiantly.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumAlert: Barton is alerted and tells the other bandits inside the room to get ready in their positions.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: I'm drinkin'. You're leavin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: holds up flask. Unfriendly.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You don't need company?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: All I need's a way out of this hellhole.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How'd you end up here in the first place?

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: So you can handle yourself. Not bad - those druids really should have known better.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

AD_Refugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: I just want to go home.
Trainee001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He just wants to go back home and be safe again.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: Goblins might not even come. Right?

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.text: You're alive! Did you get the idol? Is that why they went crazy?
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: surprised, pleased, slightly breathless - she has been hiding from an attack, and just realised it's over

HideoutLeader.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader.text: Not sure what happened to the idol.

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You're a person with many faces.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: I was able to wiggle a toe earlier - I guess that potion is finally wearing off. Terrible timing, as usual.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: I knew Kagha had twisted them, but for so many to turn on us...

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: Thank you for standing with us. I need to check on my people, but come see me when you have a chance.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

AD_Trainer.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer.text: Children - find a place to hide. Don't come out 'til I call.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: How long will you be down here, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Just until it's safe to go out. Don't worry. How about a story in the meantime?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: A little petulant sounding but you actually really wanted a story

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

PetWolf.speaker: Silver
PetWolf.text: Master says you're good. Told me to protect you. But one wrong move, and your flesh is mine.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: Thought we were safe here. But nowhere's safe, is it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: You look ready. Wish it were contagious.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: I'm glad we were here - who knows what would have happened otherwise?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: Thanks for gutting the druid bastards. Only wish I could've taken a few myself.

ExcitedBoar.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar.text: I should've known. All two-legs are the same!

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

RangerTrader.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: CinematicNodeContext: (idol stolen)InternalNodeContext: Reaction from druids if players steal the idol in their vicinity without being pacified first.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.text: The time has come. Remove the outsiders.
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: A grim conclusion at the end - a call for a huge battle between druids and tieflings.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: Calling for the druids to attack all the inhabitants of the grove.

DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Scammer.speaker: Nerela
Scammer.context: NodeContext: She's trying to act natural.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: I got three. Or five. I forget.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: I think we made those animal people mad.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: One of the other tiefling children stole an idol from the druids - she thinks they're attacking because they're mad about that. She's scared.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.text: We had the druids to worry us before. Not anymore. We can defend this place.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.text: This place could use a little light.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: a little wry. she wants to cut down some trees.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can beat them, can't you?

AD_SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef.text: We're done running. Hold your ground!

AD_ParentA.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: You fought them all, didn't you? Whoa.
Trainee002.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The druids are dealt with.

AD_FleeAfter.speaker: Zorru
AD_FleeAfter.text: Vicious gith. Murderous druids. I've had enough!

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.speaker: Amek
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.text: Couldn't be helped. Those druids left us no choice.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: 'We did what we had to'

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: We should be used to the knives in our backs by now.
SonOfChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arms crossed.NodeContext: His people have been betrayed - yet again - through no fault of their own. The druids have been dealt with.

SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef.text: Good thing you were with us.
SonOfChef.context: NodeContext: Sighing a bit, trying to find a positive in the situation. The druids have been dealt with.

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith_PostEA: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
session_synopses.AD_Trainer: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.
session_synopses.AD_YoungLover01: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.
session_synopses.AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.
session_synopses.Kid004: Kid responses related to druid attack.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.
session_synopses.PetWolf: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.
session_synopses.Protester3: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.
session_synopses.AD_DruidLeader: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
session_synopses.ParentB: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
session_synopses.ExcitedBoar: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.
session_synopses.AD_ServantPlight: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.
session_synopses.AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.
session_synopses.AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.
session_synopses.Protester2: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)
session_synopses.RangerTrader: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
session_synopses.LINE_DruidToCombat: The player angered the druids by tampering with the Idol of Silvanus of by performing a serious crime.Kagha reacts if it's triggering near her. Otherwise, 'generic' druids are used for the off screen voices and call to arms shot.Can also trigger if the player goes hostile to Kagha in dialogue.
session_synopses.IrritatedTiefling: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.
session_synopses.DruidOpposed: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Protester1: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)
session_synopses.Scammer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_TraineesAfterAttack: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.
session_synopses.AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack
session_synopses.RobberKid: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling001: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.
session_synopses.AD_SonOfChef: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.
session_synopses.AD_ParentA: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.
session_synopses.ServantPlight: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.
session_synopses.ParentA: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.
session_synopses.AD_FoodTrader: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.
session_synopses.AD_DruidGuard1: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.
session_synopses.YoungLover02: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.
session_synopses.DruidGuard002: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.AD_Apprentice: Nettie and the other druids are forced to drive out the tieflings by force. ADs cover the attack, moving to attack position, and ADs while Nettie's waiting to strike. Nettie doesn't want to kill anyone, and hopes the tieflings will leave until the very end, but will fight if she needs to.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.Trainee002: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.
session_synopses.AD_FleeAfter: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.
session_synopses.AD_ProtestersAfterAttack: Three tieflings (who had previously been protesting their treatment at the hands of their druid hosts) react to the aftermath of a bloody confrontation between tiefling refugees and druids. In this instance the druids have all been killed. The refugees are shaken and angry.
session_synopses.CharmedKid: Two states: one where the child is about to get attacked by the druids and is panicking, and one where the player has saved him and he's grateful.
session_synopses.SonOfChef: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Ikaron is entirely focused on saving his people from the druids. Afterward, he's introspective, hurt that he and his people have had another safe harbour turn against him. Still, he is glad the players were there to help win the day.

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Memnos
GuardsAvenge.text: Arka, wait! You can't just shoot her!

GuardsAvenge.speaker: Arka
GuardsAvenge.text: Why not? That's what her kind did to Kanon.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.text: That goblin won't be the last.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Player
GuardsIdle.text: It was a nice shot, if nothing else.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.context: NodeContext: Processing the fact. In the next line, she'll be resolved to kill more goblins

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Door's open, I see. 'Elp me escape, an' I'll introduce ya to my tribe, all friendly-like.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Get me outta 'ere, an' I'll introduce you to my tribe. You'd like 'em.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: All right. You've captured my interest.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: You won't regret it, promise.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Priestess Gut will give a little under-dweller like you all the blessings of the Absolute.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: A goblin healer? That's a new one. But she might be the only way to keep our skulls intact.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: She's worth talking to, at least.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.GuardsAvenge: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.GuardsIdle: Arka and Memnos are idle in the druid grove after going to confront the captive goblin Sazza. The goblin may or may not have been killed in this prior scene. Arka remains bitter over the recent death of their friend, Kagha, while Memnos, if present, tries to shake her out of it.
session_synopses:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
session_synopses.PAD_Healer: Played after being told by Sazza about Gut.Speaker 1 is the character who left the dialog. Neutral inquisitive remark about whether the rumoured healer could really help.Speaker 2 is any other party member. Line can be opinionated.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: What will we do for work when we get to the city?

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: I think I'd make a fine teacher. Or a baker. Or a butcher.

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Surprise she'd say she wants to be a butcher

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Bex has just said something strange, he's pretending to kind of ignore it.

session_synopses.AD_Shared: The two young lovers are enthusiastically making plans for when they arrive in Baldur's Gate.

VB_ReturnedToGrove.speaker: Player
VB_ReturnedToGrove.text: I was a slave when we were last here. I do not appreciate being reminded of that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

Cyanide.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide.text: Don't worry about him on the table. I'm not in the habit of killing drow.
Cyanide.context: NodeContext: gesturing to dead drow on the table

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then Kagha's treachery. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait patiently.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did you see another drow?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: That's neither here nor there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Look, you obviously want something. What is it?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you good enough to treat people, or just pets?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Good enough to tell there's nothing obviously wrong with you.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A bit tired, maybe. But we're all a bit tired.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No good way of putting this. I... uh... have a tadpole in my head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A tadpole? A mind flayer tadpole?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suddenly grave, giving you her full attention. A mind flayer is an incredibly dangerous creature.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What other kinds are there? It's not like a frog hopped in my eye.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: That's... a serious condition.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Considering her options

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come, follow me. I might be able to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: I don't feel too good. What did that druid scratch me with?
PAD_FeelingSick.context: NodeContext: Poison is slowly taking effect. You don't feel great, but it's nothing serious yet.

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: And? Will you swear you'd die before you turn?
LockedUp.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't have the wyvern poison in her inventory, player pickpocketed it already

LockedUp.speaker: Player
LockedUp.text: Fine, just give it to me.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.Cyanide: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_ToStorage: Nettie has arrived with the 'infected' player and is  gesturing for them go into the storage unit.
session_synopses.PAD_FeelingSick: |The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. The player is slowly dying.The first stage is right after being stung by Nettie in the situation Halsin's Apprentice (the reaction of the player is covered in the dialog DEN_Apprentice_Cyanide).This PAD plays after a long rest: the player rested but the status is worsening. The status is getting to stage 2 and then to stage 3, each time having worse gameplay effects.After stage 3, the status kills the player; the PAD DEN_Apprentice_PAD_Dying plays in that case.|
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Step, parry, strike - ugh. Again, again.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing. Not looking at player.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Sorry, sorry. I've just never seen... your face is... well. I should get back to it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Apologising, A little unnerved by a gith

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Interesting technique. Having some trouble?

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Nothing but. Goblins in the wilds, out for blood. And the druids in here, looking to kick us out - or worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: unloading his burdens

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Demonstrate a swing - show him the fluidity of movement he lacks.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mimics a sword swing.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Like this, you mean? Step-step, strike! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

AD_Captive.speaker: Findal
AD_Captive.text: The little thieves would have picked the whole grove clean.
AD_Captive.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself as he searches through stolen goods

session_synopses.AD_Captive: ADs for druid scout when he returns to the tiefling kids' area and finds it full of stolen goods, after the tieflings are gone

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?
002.context: NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

002.speaker: Player
002.text: I just wanted to give you my smell. I'll leave you be.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: No - wait. You smell fresh. Safe. You can stay. If you must.
002.context: NodeContext: He's relazed, and wants the player to stay, though he doesn't want to admit it.

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Hmph. I thought you were Halsin.

004.speaker: Narrator
004.text: *The boar prances around, haunches clenching and unclenching impatiently.*
004.context: NodeContext: the player is describing the feelings of a tame boar that is hoping we've brought it something it craves - it's quite desperate

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Where's Halsin? He promised me a mate!

session_synopses.AD_Birdsong: Ad where the bird sings (when he is persuaded to sing instead of caring about his nest).
session_synopses.002: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.
session_synopses.004: A tame boar in the druid grove who craves the company of his own kind

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Gan
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill so many goblins.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Challenging - "You can't be doing more than me!"

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill six hundred.

session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

AD_WithChef.speaker: Okta
AD_WithChef.text: Shouldn't you be getting home? The grove ain't safe.
AD_WithChef.context: NodeContext: Said in a 'why don't you fuck off an leave' tone

AD_WithChef.text: Leave while folk still need my lotions and potions? I simply couldn't.

AD_WithChef.speaker: Okta
AD_WithChef.text: Couldn't pass up the chance to make some coin, you mean.
Wait for Baldur's Gate, love. The coin you'll make shining shoes and scrubbing chamber pots - you won't know yourself.
AD_WithChef.context: NodeContext: You are absolutely insulting okta while smiling kindly

AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Calling out to someone she has seen but not met. Friendly and inviting.

session_synopses.AD_WithChef: Ethel and Okta are about 2m from each other. Ethel is tending her stand and selling 'lotions and potions' while Okta is cooking at a large pot - doing her best to make enough food for all the tieflings. Okta is slightly sick of Ethel poking her nose in things, and while doing her best to be polite, her grumpiness and annoyance is poking through.
session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: This is the hag calling out to a player she doesn't know. The player is a distance from her, and she is cheerily waving a hello.

AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild.text: Is this the first time I've caused a child's death?

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild: Dark Urge sees a dead child after the destruction of the Den at the hands of goblins

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: See how you feel when your pack is empty - it'll be this or a handful of weeds.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards herself. NodeContext: Player has rudely turned down your food. You're annoyed and offended.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being a spoilt idiot.Sounds very annoyed now.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried about her son but hiding it behind a gruff and sharp tone.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He knows it's just because she's worried and is trying not to sound exasperated.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Sounding more worried and concerned.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Gently trying to reassure her without sounding annoyed.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Terrified for her son but trying to hide it.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.NodeContext: Mumbled - he's still half asleep and doesn't want to wake up. Can be said with a yawn, and have a snore after it.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear.text: Could you move just a little bit? I need to use the elevator.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up and moves.NodeContext: long groan, then she agrees to move - she's still very sleepy.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4.text: Sounds like you've crossed paths with Aradin before.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Yeah, when he ran off with the druid that saved our hides the first time.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Without Halsin... this grove's not so friendly, I'll tell you that.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
