session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.
session_synopses.AD_RaidersAtPool: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
session_synopses.LeaderKid: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
session_synopses.AD_CaringForOx: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.
session_synopses.AD_RikkaAndDoni: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.
session_synopses.ChefAndSon: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.GoblinLush: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_BossyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.
session_synopses.RaiderStupid: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Mule1: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.
session_synopses.Apprentice: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonPacking: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived
session_synopses.AD_CoweringStargazer: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.
session_synopses.BackupVictory: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..
session_synopses.Trainee001: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.
session_synopses.RaiderBold: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove
session_synopses.Sapper_001: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.
session_synopses.RaiderCunning: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight
session_synopses.AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.
session_synopses.AD_LoversOverTortured: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.
session_synopses.Tiefling010: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
session_synopses.RaiderFunny: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge
session_synopses.RaiderChieftain: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RaiderHefty: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Servant001: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.
session_synopses.AD_PotionRaiders: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.
session_synopses.Melee_001: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.AD_Sappers: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriend: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.
session_synopses.ParentA: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.
session_synopses.Refugee001: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.
session_synopses.AD_GettingArmed: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.
session_synopses.WarchiefBrave: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees
session_synopses.Ranged_001: The goblins have just won a bloody victory over innocent civilians.
session_synopses.AD_CraftyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.AD_CharmedKidStory: Mirkon is a fallback, telling a story if the bard isn't present. He's excitedly telling the story about how he got caught by the harpies and the player rescued him.
session_synopses.PAD_LairDoorBlocked: The door to the druid's lair is blocked. Player can't get inside to help people get in.
session_synopses.HalsinReturns: The Druid Grove has been saved (because either the attacking force was repelled or its leaders were assassinated) and Halsin returns. He thanks the player and reacts to events that may have transpired in the grove during his absence. He's previously promised to help the player with their tadpole problem, but he defers this discussion until the next morning after the victory celebrations.
session_synopses.AD_InstructionsForKids: Rikka is firmly giving instructions to children before they depart on a dangerous journey.

AD_Adventurer2AtGate.speaker: Remira
AD_Adventurer2AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor. NodeContext: Terrified. Thinks she's about to die.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: Now that that's settled, we can get to finding a healer.

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.text: That pack of goblins will be on us any second!

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: to KanonNodeContext: to Kanon

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.text: Goblins are on our tail. Open the gate, Zevlor. Now.

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Zevlor
PleaAtTheGate.text: You led goblins here? Where is the druid?

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin

 Barth : Alert of the danger / Get distracted by Aradin
NodeContext: Desperate

Zevlor : Not in shot

PleaAtTheGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: A9 - Bow are armed and arrow are shot. The Goblin are hiding in the bushes, this is an ambush. ( mocap one multiple time  (3 is good))

Zevlor : Avoid the volley of arrows / See Kanon get hitNodeContext: Caught by suprise, Like loosing his best friend

AD_WyllCharge.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I should've known. Can't trust a devil.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: Watch your tongue. Before it's too late.

Adventurer1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

AD_AdventurerWakesUp.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerWakesUp.context: NodeContext: Just waking up from being knocked out, rubbing his jaw.

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.text: That was the last of them. Inside - all of you. More may follow.
OpenGate.context: NodeContext: Shouted down to us - at the bottom of the gate

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Zevlor calls for gate to open (custom camera)NodeContext: Calling out o someone standing on his level, but not extremely close.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.context: NodeContext: Situation didn't pan out very well - but no-one died. Slightly relieved but unsure.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.context: NodeContext: Someone has remarked 'it could have been worse'

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerWakesUp: Player when the adventurer leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.
session_synopses.OpenGate: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderSpotsWyll: Plays when Avatar is Wyll in raiding party, during combat.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves: VB played after the adventurer leader has fled the DEN in Raiding Party.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.

AD_LookingForInstrument.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_InstrumentBroken.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentBroken.context: NodeContext: Player has broken her precious lute. You're upset and yelling at the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: It is quite a racket. You could just spare your ears by leaving.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: We can't! Our brains are melting!

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Corinna, drag me away! The big one is right - we should go, before it's too late.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: With my last strength, I will save us both! Away. Away.
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: played dramatics

session_synopses.AD_LookingForInstrument: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.
session_synopses.AD_InstrumentBroken: The bars is sitting alone - crying. Player has broken her instrument.
session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: Looks like the druids have eased off some. Small mercies.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents.speaker: Player
Parents.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.
session_synopses.Protester2: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.Parents: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees the landscape ahead through the telescope lens - the dragon is gone

Telescope.speaker: Player
Telescope.text: Focus the telescope on the distant object, trying to get a clear view.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.text: *You see a dragon circling like a bird of prey. Hunting.*
Telescope.context: NodeContext: watching the dragon through a telescope so fear but no immediate danger

session_synopses.Telescope: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: Ugh, no matter. As long as I keep the damn thing safe.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

PAD_FirstInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstInsight.text: I'd swear that ox's gaze is following me.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstInsight: The player walks past and, if they notice (pass an insight check), responds to the ox looking at them strangely.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.text: You're curious - you've got a great many odours about you. What happened to you?
Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear sits back to listen to you.

Bear.speaker: Player
Bear.text: That's a complicated story. I doubt you'd understand.

session_synopses.Bear: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

VB_UnlockedStudy.speaker: Player
VB_UnlockedStudy.text: Well well, what have we here.

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text: *The mural depicts a ritual, but you do not recognise the deity involved.*

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
the moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *History or myth. Whatever is depicted here is long past.*

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.VB_UnlockedStudy: |You retrieved the missing wolf rune, placed it back in the socket, clicked on the 4 runes and now the wolf statue is sinking down in the ground, revealing spiral stairs.|
session_synopses.FrescoFoundingGrove: Player is examining a mural on the wall of the Druid's Grove, depicting its foundation.
session_synopses.FrescoAlliance: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting two sides agreeing an alliance. Pass a test to realise that one side are the druids of the wild, and the other the Harpers - a secret organisation.
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Only going to ask you one more time, boy. Hand over my locket.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: I don't have your ugly locket. I've never even seen it before!

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Hand it over or I'll slap the teeth out of your head.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Don't you dare lay a finger on that child.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Forget it. I don't want any trouble.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: And I thought he was a coward.
CinematicNodeContext: |*The adventurer stares down at the defiant child, wavering, fists clenching*|
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*The adventurer stares down at the defiant child, wavering, fists clenching*|

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Barth strikes the child Meli. The child cries out in pain.|

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: Feel better? Or were you hoping I'd cry?
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: In pain, defiantNodeContext: In pain, defiant

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: You like watching people hit kids? You happy now?
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kid turns to the player, angry.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: Bad news, children: you're all going to die.

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.RobbedAdventurer:
Non-critpath. A human adventurer accuses a tiefling child of stealing a necklace from him. A tiefling guard may intervene if things get out of hand. 

Barth: Angry, but gruff and restrained. 
Meli: Fearless, urging Barth on.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.

Dead.speaker: Rolan
Dead.text: Too fast but... can't be. Must finish...

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We don't even know these people!
AD.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hold on. Why are you so eager to reach the city?

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You sound excited.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I've admired Lorroakan for years. Never dreamed he'd answer my letter.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses his hero. He looks and sounds younger in this moment. Pure enthusiasm and excitement.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: But I've worked myself to the bone for this. Few can match me - in either magic or talent.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Determined even as he's sounding overconfident. He has truly has worked his ass off to get here.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: The names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known far and wide. You'll see.

session_synopses.Dead: Rolan has been killed. Even in corpse form, his desire to become the greatest wizard in all of Faerun is clear.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.

002.speaker: Marcoryl
002.text: You may have won over Kagha, but I'm not so easily swayed.

session_synopses.002: A very condescending and somewhat objectionable druid servant. He believes the tiefling refugees hiding in the grove have brought chaos and would gladly be rid of them, even if turning them away would doom them.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

Resting.speaker: Narrator
Resting.text: *The adventurer sleeps soundly, his breath steady, his wounds expertly bandaged.*

session_synopses.Resting: Small dialogue when you find Liam sleeping in the den after freeing him in the goblin camp.

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeCharmed: The tiefling kid has been charmed, and is being controlled by a beautiful song that beckons him forth, promising everything will be all right if he follows.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest

HeadedToCave.speaker: Zevlor
HeadedToCave.text: Find me in the caves. I need to let people know we're moving.
HeadedToCave.context:
InternalNodeContext: Player clicks on Zevlor while he is getting back to his default position in the cave after the confrontation.
When Zevlor finally reaches the cave, his dialog is switched to DEN_TieflingLeader

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Looks like we're in Elturgard. Some distance from the city of Baldur's Gate.
PAD_ZevlorsMap.context: NodeContext: Karlach, grumbling about being so far from BG

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Gnolls and goblins marked on the map. Travel won't be easy.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.context: InternalNodeContext: Remember he could have been KO by Aradin. The flag PostConfrontationDone will make him move after the dialogNodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: A cheap shot - to be expected from a drow. But you helped us, so instead of killing you, I'll just ask:
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Sneering, barely keeping his temper in check

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Who in the Nine Hells do you think you are?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. What I won't tolerate is a stranger waltzing in here and interfering in our business.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked that adventurer trash into leaving.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Cautionary - his people are also being forced out

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I'll see what I can do.

session_synopses.HeadedToCave: |Zevlor's default dialog need a timeline context, so this dialog here is used as a transition when Zevlor is walking back to his default spot after a big event happened in the Grove. There's 2 cases: after the raiding party and after druid attack.|
session_synopses.PAD_ZevlorsMap: |Player clicked on Zevlor's map (a map of Elturgard that shows the road to Baldur's Gate). Zevlor will likely have drawn on it.|
session_synopses.DenIntro: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. He'll show a flash of anger and frustration at the start if the player struck him, but is pragmatic enough to calm himself once he realises you could be more help to him than harm.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: To think we almost finished the ritual...
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: I felt honoured when I was chosen to participate. Now I feel guilty I didn't object.
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: Do you hear them? The birds. They're beautiful.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I've thought of nothing but goblins and tieflings for so long, I stopped listening.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's referring to her anxiety preventing her from listening to the birds in the grove.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: You think you saved us? You just prolonged the inevitable.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: Sooner or later, other outsiders will bring trouble to the grove.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

AD_RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

PAD_RecognizeRite.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite.text: That ritual. A common growth spell, but... altered, somehow.

PAD_RecognizeRite.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite.text: But nothing to worry about... right?

session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Elwyn is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Elwyn is conflicted - she knows why the ritual had to be stopped, but she's scared that they've been left defenceless.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Elwyn is calm but exhausted, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.The player always encounters Elwyn around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Tahani is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Tahani is furious that players stopped the ritual - even though Kagha had ulterior motives, Tahani still believes her path was best and that players had no right to intervene.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Tahani isn't convinced the threat is really over. She thinks her fellow druids will lead them down the same path again, taking pity on people that will only bring trouble to their door.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool. She's more or less the xenophobic conservative of the chanting druids.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid5: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Tahani was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In both states, Tahani is bitter, muttering her xenophobic ideas to herself. She thinks the tieflings (and the player) are the cause of all their troubles and that they should've been thrown out a long time ago.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.PAD_RecognizeRite: The voicebark is triggered after talking to one of the druids performing the ritual. It's always a DRUID in the party that react first. This VB won't fire after talking to Kagha and getting all the details about the ritual

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Kagha's a Shadow Druid. She means to convert the circle.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: A Shadow Druid? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

002.speaker: Narrator
002.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

002.speaker: Narrator
002.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedDenounce.context: NodeContext: An edge of anger in his voice. He was betrayed and is sorting through it.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: If it's an argument you seek, you won't find it here.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: Whatever the Treefather's judgement, I will accept it in full.

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: We're grateful for your efforts - though none more than the refugees.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve of this.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: He's... he's really gone, then. That means...

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Treefather, make us tall as the ash and stout as the spruce. I...

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Oh, hells - the prayer can wait. I'm... I'm going to miss him.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.002: A shadow Druid in rat form. Using speak with animals doesn't result in anything useful.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedDenounce: Player persuaded Kagha to not join the shadow druids after all. Kagha and Rath survived the combat and are talking together now. Kagha is good, repentant.
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.LeaderPostGoblins: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: I told them to run, the idiots.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better turn north here, or you'll end up like them.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: So you just left your friend to the goblins?

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: These weren't no normal goblins. And Liam weren't no friend, all right?
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: Immediately defensive - you're questioning her courage and suggesting she has feelings, two cardinal sins

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Just another raw recruit thought he was in some storybook.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, disgusted - it's his own fault he's dead. Or that's what she's trying to tell herself.

VB_AtCorpses.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses.text: I wonder where they were going.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

session_synopses.RaidAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades she left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.VB_AtCorpses: Remarking on corpses on the road.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_DrunkenTalk: Aradin mutters to himself while drinking after returning to the Druid Grove.

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Player
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: Apologise. You were mistaken to touch their holy relic.
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Player
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: Children? I haven't spoken to any children.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *Your words may be false, but they ring truer than Mol's tales. You're off the hook.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your words are futile. The goblin will not be allowed to leave. Neither will you.*

session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.
session_synopses.Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: The tadpole was tampered with? That complicates things...

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: Tampered or not, we need to get these things out of our heads. Let's find another way.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleDivine: This VB plays after attempting to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. She confesses that there's something special about it and she can't remove it.Will play on the player who leaves the dialog that reveals this fact, but characters can be fairly opinionated here since they are reacting to knowledge.Up to two characters.

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: You gave him up? I wasn't sure you would.

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: He's too dangerous to have around. We'd always be sleeping with one eye open.

session_synopses.PAD_BetrayedAstarion: PAD that plays if you decide to tell the Gur Hunter in the Swamp where to find Astarion (HAG_GurHunter.lsj).  You tell the Hunter where your camp is, the Hunter says he'll take Astarion during the night the next time you go to sleep, then the dialog ends and this PAD plays.Your companion reacts to your decision to hand Astarion over (speaker 2) and then you clarify/justify your decision (speaker 1)

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

session_synopses.WRLD_GettingBloodFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for redcap getting blood from a trough

AD_HagThankPlayer.text: Come here and let me see you proper, petal. We need to chat.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.AD_HagThankPlayer: This occurs after the ambush. Player has sided with Ethel and killed the brothers. Player has either not spoken to Ethel yet OR they are wildshaped and cannot speak.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: Quietly whisper a blessing for protection. May Mayrina and her child suffer no harm.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: I miss him. Every moment of every day. Godsdammit.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at yourself as you sturggle to hold back tears. Just about keeping it together

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband turned into summon, Mayrina does not know this player has killed her brothers, or this player indeed had nothing to do with that.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player took your husband and made him a slave.

PAD_FireplaceIllusion.speaker: Player
PAD_FireplaceIllusion.text: Fireplace isn't real. What's hidden behind it?

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

session_synopses.ResurrectHusband: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.PAD_FireplaceIllusion: This triggers near the fireplace in the hag's home. If you see through the illusion, you realise that there is a passage way behind it. Otherwise you just see a pleasant fire.
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.

PAD_HeroGear.speaker: Player
PAD_HeroGear.text: Sword and a hat. Wonder whose.

PAD_PrickedFinger.speaker: Player
PAD_PrickedFinger.context:
NodeContext: Noise of pain. Your finger has been pricked by a thorn.

Karlach: 'Fing' is on purpose

session_synopses.PAD_HeroGear: A fine sword and feathered hat protrude from the bog. A successful passive Investigation check suggests that long ago a hero came here to slay something, but didn't make it past the first patch of soft ground.
session_synopses.PAD_PrickedFinger: The player has pricked their finger on a thorny bush. The player encounters a thorny bush full of fruit. In order to take the fruit from the bush without cutting theirself, the player must pass a Sleight of Hand test.

Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.text: No, Ethel! I'm sorry! I'll go back! Argh.

session_synopses.Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack: Lorin has been ordered to stay in the corner by the hag. The player has forced him out, and he is absolutely panicking - he knows the hag will punish him. He calls out, begging for forgiveness before clutching his heart as he experiences a massive heart attack and collapses on the floor - dead.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who are you?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Today? The same as you - a humble supplicant, come to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a teahouse - hardly a lair.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A charming sight, to be sure. But the prettiest web still has a spider sitting at its centre.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of sign for tea-house here if possible.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What price is that?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Whatever's easiest to lose and hardest to do without.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But the thing I hunt has gone to ground. If she can tell me how to draw him out, I'll pay whatever she asks.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing grave

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who is it you're hunting?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Truth is like a blade, my friend. We can arm ourselves with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Or just as easily find it pressed against our throat. I would not put you in danger.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grave - we're asking a question he believes we don't really want the answer to. The warning is for our own good, not a threat

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Never mind. I already regret asking.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Questions should never bring you regret, my friend. Answers are another matter.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Softening the blow of his refusal to answer our questions

session_synopses: Male, middle-age or older.Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.

AD_Frog.speaker: Addled Frog
AD_Frog.context: NodeContext: Cheerful. Calling out to player. Onw to 'present.'

session_synopses.AD_Frog: This is a frog in the hag's swamp. When the hag is not defeated she is fighting the hag's control - hissing and ribbiting in pain as she struggles not to hurt anyone.When the hag is defeated, she is cheerfully ribbiting as she hops about the swamp.In the top two nodes, she is showing the player a stash of loot as a reward for freeing her from the hag. Only available with SwA.

Illusioncheck.speaker: Narrator
Illusioncheck.text: *A chill runs up your spine. You feel like you're being watched.*
Look for anything out of the ordinary.

session_synopses.Illusioncheck: Dialogue covers the transition from the pretty illusion that is on the swamp to the fetid reality.Triggers when entering the area, or when the illusion is disrupted because of combat or because Ethel is dropping her disguise.This means it may play for a Wildshaped player or even a summon or follower.

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Open your peepers, freak. It's time.
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: player waking up - blinking, seeing priestess standing right before them, leaning in closeNodeContext: speaking to player who is captive, in chains - they've been resting and she's waking them

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: You should be sprouting tentacles by now, but you're still the same kind of ugly you always was.

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Disappointing not to have my own squiddie... but your giblets'll make for a tasty supper.
CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: Sorry - I may have left that a little late. No lasting damage, I hope?
Warlock.context: NodeContext: brushing herself down after killing a goblin priestess - apologetic, amused. speaking to a chained player she just rescued

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: My master has been keeping a close eye on you. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

session_synopses.Warlock:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations.Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess.

The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

node_data.speaker: Narvass
node_data.text: Silence. You'll interrupt the ritual.
