node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's watching a ritual, trying not to disturb it.NodeContext: stern, but not too loud - he doesn't want to interrupt the ritual himself.

session_synopses: Watching the goblin king perform the Speak with Dead spell.

Backup_04.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nozk
Backup_04.text: You outsiders never have ta guard the borin' posts.

session_synopses.Backup_04: One of the guards at the door to the inner temple. He's been standing here for a while and shouldn've been switched out a while ago, but the change of guard never showed. He's very bored.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why would I let anyone scar me for life?

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't just a mark on the flesh: it's magic. Only them what follows the Absolute can see it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: as if trying to explain something obvious to an idiot

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Let's us know you're on our side. That way, nobody'll mess with ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining something simple, talking down to us a little

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: 'Ere - you 'eard about wot happened on that last raid? Right so, some slob 'ad the drop on me...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eager to tell this story to anyone who'll listen

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Then she falls flat on 'er face with an arrow in 'er back! That's the Absolute that is. Protectin' me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *Decaying legs protrude from the hole - a failed escape, it seems.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: See the legs sticking out of the hole

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *You notice the corpse is very dead, but that's all.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is crouched and looking intently at the body

session_synopses.Tunnel: A body is found protruding out of a tunnel in the GOB prison. For patch 6: After pulling the body out, the player can use the tunnel to instantly escape. Patch 7: the player will need to find a shovel to dig their way out, but this will be outside the dialogue.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

Mindflayer_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

session_synopses.Mindflayer_Dead: The player casts speak with dead on the corpse of the mind flayer that tortured them at the beginning of the game.

session_synopses.SlowDown_NoGoblins: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely after they apply a brake. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Pick a different brain. I can't help you.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I'll be no trouble, my friend. Name a location and I'd be happy to meet you there.

session_synopses.Volo_Massacre: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Player
Backup002.text: Sounds like a bloody scrap. Where did you see that?

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: You ain't hear? We sacked Waukeen's Rest and left it to burn.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: Drow flingin' magic, gnolls snappin' off heads. Inn's nothin' but a pile of ash by now.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You are no goblin. Who are you? Answer me or die.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Just a visitor. I mean you no harm.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You don't mean harm. I do.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: S'pose you're right. Absolute rewards faith, not book-learnin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: after being persuaded to give something away - pleased to have learned something

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Take it. Maybe if I pray hard enough I can get some of that booyahg for myself.

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Player has finished penance. Speaking to player as if speaking to a loved one.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: Loviatar herself found your performance inspiring and wishes to bless you.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: Come now, dear child. It is time to repent.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Penance was interrupted. Player has returned to speak to Abdirak. Voice low and inviting as he wishes to continue the beating.

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: A pity. We would have such fun together.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Sigh and a shrug at the player's refusal of his penance. But a smile and a wink as he says the player can always return to him.

session_synopses.PostPenance: |Abdirak fully completed his penance with a player. It can't be tried again.|
session_synopses.DuringPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: He can't be dead! I never got any answers out of him!
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblins don't know where the den is.NodeContext: Spike is extremely worried. The palyer killed the prisoner he had to extract information from, and he's certain his commander will kill him for his failure.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: She'll kill me. This is it. This is the end... but oh, I'll make you pay before I die.
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: NodeContext: Fiercely angry - about to attack the player.

session_synopses.Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.

Chapel.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel.text: Smart. All you need to do is open yourself to the Absolute, and I'll do the rest.
Chapel.context: NodeContext: slightly more sinister than her friendlier nodes - we don't know what "the rest" is but it doesn't sound great; in actuality, she's tricking us into imprisonment and possible death

session_synopses.Chapel:
The goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's charismatic and friendly, in a crude sort of way, but has an underlying suspicion and curiosity. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Trespassing: This goblin is nearly blackout drunk and unsteady on his feet, but still trying to perform guard duties.

Spike_Dead.speaker: Torturer Spike
Spike_Dead.text: ... speaks through True Souls... scour the land... find weapon...

Rat_001.speaker: Rat
Rat_001.text: Let this one be! My prisoner, drow, not yours. Not this one. I am hungry... starving...

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: I'm watchin' ya. Spike promised that any meat that falls off is mine.
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's standing a few paces away from the prisoner.NodeContext: Mean.

session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Rat_001: Rat in the torture cell who is full of menace and going crazy because of how hungry she is.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experience a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experience a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute_ShadowheartHasBox: The party hears the voice of the Absolute, faint, in their minds.Shadowheart takes out the infernal puzzle box, it glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice stops. Player avatar questions Shadowheart about the box. If the player is not aware of Shadowheart being a Shar worshipper, then they can discover this here, if she tells them about the artefact.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Keep moving, 'less you're wanting a clubbing and drubbing.

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! What's the bloody ruckus out there?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and on-guard - she's heard a great deal of noise outside and you, a stranger, have just stumbled in

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll be asking the questions.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oh! B-beg pardon, True Soul! At y'service, of course.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Alarmed - she's just spoken sharply to someone who can kill her without a second thought.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

node_data.speaker: Rozzak
node_data.text: If you're here to help with the raid, talk to her ladyship. She's in charge.
node_data.context: NodeContext: deferential to 'her ladyship'. Dismissive toward us

session_synopses: Impatient goblin. Planning a raid with a drow, and he's deferring to her.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: You new 'ere? You look new. Strange... weird-like. For a goblin. 'S why you don't know, right?

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: I'll tell you somethin', right? Just for you. Don't upset Crusher. He'll... you know... crush.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Player
Friend1.text: Well, it didn't smell as bad as I thought it would - more like lavender.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout the smell. 'S that magic ring 'e wears. Some kinda stupid side effect.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's making a side comment.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: But the foot itself, it looked craggy, didn't it? Rugged? Big? I get excited just thinkin' about it...
Friend1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin shudders, then turns to stare wistfully into space.NodeContext: excited

session_synopses.Dead: SwD dialog for Crusher, an absolute legend (pun intended) among the goblin tribe.
session_synopses.Friend0: Goblin listening to another goblin's stories. He is very drunk and should be slurring his words.
session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: What the hells are you doing?

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.text: We're juicing it up. The beast came in here with those robbers. Killed Dink - and Mince, too.
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: first node surprised that you would stop her, as she thinks you're on her side. second node more annoyed.  She assumes that by explaining, you'll understand why they are hurting this woman.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Boss's thinkin' of servin' it to the worgs.
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: fyi, the worg cage is to the left of the cage that holds the bear. if the player is infront of the goblin mother, she might wave her right hand in that genirall direction.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Very excited. Not scared at all.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Look, look, you'll see. Gimme that rock. I'll show ya!
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: the child is excited., he makes a sweep towards the ground picking up a stone in there hand. this will happen out of shot.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Go on, then. Keep at it.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

Kid_001.speaker: One
Kid_001.text: D'you think it's bad to keep throwing stones at a dead lump?
Kid_001.context: NodeContext: curious, a bit naughty. She doesn't think it's bad at all.

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.CombatCutscene_Bear: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. The bear attacks the door that flies away and potentially kill a goblin.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Azak
node_data.text: Leave me alone - ain't got time for chatter.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraidNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraid - a slave speaking to a master

session_synopses: A goblin who is afraid of drow, having been a former slave

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Quite the trove. How'd you get your hands on all this?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Nicked 'em off the dead, didn't I?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Erh, I mean - raid spoils, your majesticality.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, bowingNodeContext: Regretting his choice of words

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: A warning, whelp. Do not threaten me.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Whatcha gonna do about it? Run off and cry to yer spider-mum?
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: talking to a drow - 'spider-mum' refers to the drow goddess Lolth. This is a deeply dangerous and blasphemous thing to say, but he's too immature and cocky to realise he could be getting himself into serious trouble. Doesn't know boundaries.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: No. I'm going to cut out your tongue.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hey, can I see yer brand? The priestess gave me one, and I think she did it wrong.
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007.speaker: Player
Goblin007.text: Priestess? Is she a healer, too?

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hold on. I was askin' you sumfin', wasn't I?
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: Drunk, trying to remember what they were talking about.

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Sorry yer drowship... didn't mean nothin' by it. I'm here to serve.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin007: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Yes, my desire. Closer, my sweet!
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, drooling with desire to eat us.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: I will wrap you, and bind you, and bite you, and eat you.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, almost to herself, thinking about how she'll eat us

Spiders.speaker: Player
Spiders.text: You should eat a goblin instead. They're delicious.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Delicious - I do not know. But cruel and sharp - yes. Bindable and wrappable and biteable - yes.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: delighted, preparing to escape and feast on goblins who have held it captive

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

session_synopses.Spiders: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit

session_synopses.GameOver: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep quiet.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Oi! You just walked into the wrong town.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at playerNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Don't bother runnin'. My archers got decent aim and plenty of arrows.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stand down. Now.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You're a True Soul... M-my mistake, your grace.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ShockedNodeContext: Threatening a true soul is BAD NEWS

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You'll get no more trouble from us, promise.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: BowsNodeContext: Groveling

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Mind the ogres, your drowsiness. They don't got no respect.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Carefully wiggle the dagger until it slides free.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your cautious method pays off. The dagger glides smoothly out of the mystery meat.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: The bugbear shouts at the players after they barge in on the couple having sex.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Selûne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
PAD_NoticeShrine.context: NodeContext: Shar worshipper: notices the Selune shrine and makes a disdainful comment. Selune worshippers: notices the shrine and reacts with reverence.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.context: NodeContext: Hushed awe. A good omen from their goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeShrine: The party comments on a little shrine they've discovered in a cavern - a grotto containing a statue and some prayers and offerings left by worshippers. Players may or may not recognise that the statue is the goddess Selûne. Shadowheart, as well as certain cleric/paladin tags, will recognise the statue always.
session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite: A Selûne-worshipping player manages to unseal a magically locked chest after reading a prayer.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_TrapStart.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.
session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_TrapStart: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.text: Better be careful - those webs carry vibrations.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: You're mistaken - I'm no True Soul.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken. Her other brother died in the owlbear fight. Trying to hold it together.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: He's... with Edowin now, right? He's with the Absolute.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Perhaps. Who truly knows the ways of our god?

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: I suppose... I suppose the Absolute keeps some mysteries from us all.
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying very hard not to cry.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: What would you have of me now, True Soul?
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying to rally. Trying to be brave.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Continue your duties in the area - whatever those are.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: Yes. That's what Edowin would say. And what Andrick would've done, too.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Saying goodbye to the player. She means it.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.Cultist002_InCave: Novice Brynna. a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by hersupposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. She reacts to the monster's presence before attacking it, then seeks orders from the player once it is dead.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.
session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of her chosen disciples.
True

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Indeed? How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Now speak or go, before my cravings conquer me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Should suddenly sound all ogre-ish and stupid. He's talking to his stupid brothers.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Alas - not so much as a nibble.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk

session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

AD_WaitingForRelease.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses.SpeedUp: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.
session_synopses.Dead: This is the gnome's spirit once he's dead. He's still focused on Wulbren, his first love, who he believes to be in danger.
session_synopses.AD_WaitingForRelease: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.text: No more than a few pecks? I'm afraid this spread is most inadequate.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.text: Our bargain is at an end - unless, perhaps, you've a spicier deal?
AfterSummon.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rubbing for finger and thumb together illuding to the oger wanting gold.NodeContext: *Dupe* [Lump The Enlightened]  Rubbing for finger and thumb together illuding to the oger wanting gold. <JACK OF>

AfterSummon.speaker: Player
AfterSummon.text: Our deal is done. I wish you well.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

session_synopses.AfterSummon: You have agreed to summon ogres up to three times for the to help you in battle. These are the leader's conversation with you each time. THis is... complicated because there could be many deals in play.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: What's this? Something weak, something tender...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing up the player.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That eye - or lack of it - must have you in a lot of pain. I should know.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Scars don't make us kindred, softmeat. And they don't make you welcome in my nest.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: You'll be missing more than your eye before I'm done.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: The meat tastes better when it's afraid.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: Nature can provide for the cub. Perhaps it'll live.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub fend for itself.

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.
session_synopses.PAD_HealedOwlbear: A short VB after player heals the Owlbear in gameplay. Owlbear is still dangerous, though. This can happen either before or after the player has interacted with Owlbear. It's meant to give feedback on the fact that the owlbear is now healed, but not to encourage the player to provoke her.
session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.
session_synopses.VB_LastCub: After killing an adult owlbear, combat ends as the player notes that the surviving owlbear cub doesn't pose much of a threat to them.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

Dinner.speaker: Player
Dinner.text: Ignore him and fill your plate.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Not easily rattled, I see. Good. Makes the next part that much more straightforward.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: What's better than a devil you don't know?

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.context: NodeContext: Surprise, even fear in her voice. This is early in the game so she's still fresh from the hells. Referring to Raphael's first revelation of who he is.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin

session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.
session_synopses.Guard_002: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).

002.speaker: Ward Pistle

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.
