session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

01.speaker: Danna
01.text: Last time I trust a drow hoon.

Leader.speaker: Brathwen
Leader.text: Hey! Get back with the others. Now.

session_synopses.Leader: Short dialogues when i'm done doing the main 'looting' scene with this character.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

session_synopses.PAD_IdolLooted: Party loots the Idol of Shar.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

session_synopses.CaveIn: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: There's more back there. Get them out, please!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

PAD_SharTempleVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharTempleVista.text: That almost looks like... no, it couldn't be, surely...
PAD_SharTempleVista.context: NodeContext: Awe/hesitation, as if doubting what she's seeing in the distance. Has not let the player know she is a shar worshipper.

session_synopses.PAD_SharTempleVista: Shadowheart notices the Shar Temple in the Underdark

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Who hung these drow out to dry?

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Me - who else? My spiders sussed 'em out of hiding, then Nere taught 'em a thing or two, and I let 'em fly.

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - “Duergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.”One duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us he’s keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Stop, STOP!
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a loud, panicked whisper.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bibberbang!
node_data.context: NodeContext: A warning of nearby danger

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He's indeed surrounded by bibberbang - the spores of those mushrooms are both toxic and flammable.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the name - bibberbang, a mushroom that releases dangerous spores. Highly flammable.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn away.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Wait! Please, hear me out!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Scroll - escape! My bag! Please. I've dropped it - somewhere!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This is your mess - figure it out yourself.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bloody greyskin!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a duergar/grey dwarf abandoning him to his fate.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: I-I mean... I didn't mean that.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Backpedalling on his previous insult - he still needs help.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Please - can't... can't get out...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dejected and worried.

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.
node_data.context:
NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

Clan-sen means a duergar from another clan. Pronounced like it is spelled.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*
Looted_Solo.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player goes into a crouch, looks over the bodies

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're free - go on.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Free. Yes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wavering.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: They're not even going after him. I wish I were surprised.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

Boat.speaker: Narrator
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Should share sequence with *A vessel wobbles on the lake's murky waters.*

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: First time using the boat, sailing to the camp

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: I saw a body left by the myconids - your 'Gekh' must be dead.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What a load of rothé shite. No way a mushroom killed Gekh.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.Boat: Raft dialogue. The player can decide either to sail somewhere or to walk away from the raft.
session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Beldron - I was so worried! Did Nere hurt you?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Beldron

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: No, no - I'm all right. Did the sergeant hurt you?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Lunkbug

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Who cares? We're together now, thank Ironhand!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Beldron. The two gnomes embrace, and then pull apart.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We ought to thank someone a little closer by, I think.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Tired, wry - referencing the player when his husband thanks the gods

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Gaerdal Ironhand you may not be, but you damn well fight like him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impressed with you - someone thanked the war-god Ironhand and he's implying you're the next best thing

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I'm grateful, don't mistake me, but... why help us? You're one of them, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Guarded, sizing the player up - he thinks we're one of the cultists

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The cult thinks it owns me. I beg to differ.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: That didn't much look like begging. But no complaints from me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Referencing the player's recent slaughter of his captors

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: You did just lift a mountain from our heads, so... good enough for me, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, accepting - not going to look a gift horse in the mouth

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Here - the Ironhand Gnomes honour their debts. With Wulbren gone, that falls to me.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'handing reward' animation.NodeContext: Drawing himself up to perform a necessary obligation - doesn't see himself as leadership material but accepts the responsibility

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Make it quick! We need to find Wulbren - now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Surely you can do me a little more honour than that.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I wish I could. But most of our funds rested with our leader, Wulbren. He'll be in Moonrise Towers by now.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We were just slave-hands to the cult, but not Wulbren. He... knows things. Things they want to know too.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to say exactly what Wulbren knows

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What has he gotten himself mixed up in now...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Before you ask, no - I'm not going to stage a rescue.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Aye. Nor us, I'm afraid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: shrugging, a little defeated. This line trails off into another 'Much as I want to march after Wulbren myself... we can't.'

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We have our own freedom to look to, I'm afraid. We'll take our chance when it arises, then back to the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: His people are still enslaved - he needs to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Wulbren knew the risks when he came in search of runepowder. We all did.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses: The gnome leader's main dialogue. He thanks you for saving them, and tells you what brought his people to the Underdark to begin with - an expedition led by their charismatic leader Wulbren, to find a forgotten gnomish explosive of awesome power - runepowder.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: The eye's clobbered - good work. Time to bust Nere out and shred him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Our blood to fill your oceans, oh blessed BOOOAL! Our bones to build your temple in the deep!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: NodeContext: Fanatic devotion, speaking to the air/altar

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *A wave of pure devotion washes over you - and with every surge, you feel a presence grow in response.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: WORDS, PRIEST. PROMISES. YOUR GOD WANTS PROOF. WANTS BLOOD.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his god form. He should be invisible with some VFXNodeContext: DISMISSIVE, IMPATIENT

SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *These beings are kuo-toa - former mind flayer slaves that manifest their gods through sheer belief.*
CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: YOU! Our Lord of Murder demands sacrifice! You will be an offering for the great god BOOOAL!

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal is the true Lord of Murder. Perhaps I should offer you instead.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal...? No... we are... we are faithful to Lord BOOOAL...

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You sense a flicker of doubt - brief, but enough. For an instant, the godly presence falters.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: NO! NO! Stop that!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back to his common form. He is invisible for "NO! NO" and becomes visible for "Stop that!"NodeContext: Furious, panicked - his con is being exposed and he's losing power even as he speaks

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: He's a fabrication. Whatever you created him for, you don't need him.
True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ARGH! NO! SHUT IT! Shut your rotten mouth!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back into his common form. He is invisible for the capitalised parts of this now, but then becomes visible for "Shut your rotten mouth"NodeContext: The lack of faith is literally draining power from him - sulky and furious all in one as he returns to his common form

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You feel the presence waver - one moment a god of awesome power, the next... a common redcap.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Ah. Bollocks.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and he appears as a redacapNodeContext: Realising the game is up

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Don't do anything hasty, now. The fishfolk got plenty of power - we can share.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and appears as a common redcapNodeContext: Still annoyed with us but willing to make a deal. Only SLIGHTLY wheedling - redcaps aren't known for negotiating

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ... blessed Boooal... what...?

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Shut it, you!  I'm talking to... my Chosen! Chosen got power - you want power, don't ya?
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and just appears as an ordinary redcapNodeContext: Shouting his high priest down - he wants to seal the deal with us before his idiot followers fully catch on

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: I'll just kill you and claim it for myself.

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.SpeakWithBOOOAL: The player encounters a group of kuo-toa, humanoid fish beings capable of creating gods just by imagining them. They're overzealous and easily duped, and are currently worshipping a murderous redcap they've mistaken for a god of murder. He's capitalising on the situation and very much enjoying the incredible power with which he's been invested. In this dialogue, we can deal with him as this great inscrutable power, or see through the situation and expose / do a deal with him. In all cases he's brash, offensive and generally gross.The all cap lines are BOOOAL in his fully powerful form.When we suddenly rever to lower caps, it's when we've forced him into his 'common' form.BOOOAL = Boo-AHHL (almost guttural)Kuo-Toa = Koo-oh-TO-ah
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.
session_synopses.KuoToaMinion: A  node that plays when the player tries to click on a praying kuotoa. They will either praise you as the Chosen of their madeup god, or make you a new made-up god.BOOOAL - Booh-ALMahkloompah - mak-LOOM-pah

node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Just leave me, I said. You've done enough damage already.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I greet you, friend of the dark.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body.*

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *A voice drifts into your mind as you gaze upon the misshapen servant.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: Why not. Spaw's time is done.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*come, then. bring me to Spaw and I will sing its doom*))

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: Who are you? What are you?

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: What was life in the circle like?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: ((*...floating, knowing, seeing, hearing. all together, never apart...*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: What were you doing when you died?

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.
session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.
session_synopses.Squad_Wizard: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: You got those boots? Or something else eatin' at you?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - what are those marks there?

session_synopses.PAD: The player spots a sign of Thulla's escape: footprints. Player wishes to take a closer look.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.

session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.
session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!

PAD_NobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_NobleStalk.text: Strange... I remember a tiefling boy. Purple hair... Rennald. Who is that?
PAD_NobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Unsure. Relaying a strange memory fragment that's just been restored to her. Ren-awld

session_synopses.PAD_NobleStalk: Fallback in case the memory stalk dialog does not start. Cheap version of the memory.

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: Enter Nere's mind. 'The gnomes must be set free.'

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere reacts to a brief mindmeld while maintaining the spell at the ready, then frowns at the player before delivering his line

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: But I know you are a traitor - and I will show no mercy!

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

session_synopses.FollowUp: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.
session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

AD_BeckonPlayer.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *Your spirits are sky-high, and your steps unreasonably light.*
The agony of ecstasy - ha ha HEE! Why must pleasure bring such pain?

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *A smile reaches your lips, then melts away. A full laugh could be next.*

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Whatever. I'm not afraid of the dark.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Well you should be. That stuff will end you in two flaps of a batwing.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

LoyalFollowUp.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp.text: Shit - True Soul Nere's nothing but grub-chow now.

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

HangedDrow_Dead.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead.text: Last Light... safe haven... in shadows...

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.LoyalFollowUp: Player has sided with Nere, but Nere and Thrinn are dead by the time combat is over. In that case, a duergar initiates dialogue and tells you his plans and you get to decide the gnomes' fate.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.HangedDrow_Dead: Player finds drow corpse hanging in a cage in Grymforge. When you click on it you discover that it was a Harper who came here, and could get some foreshadowing about Last Light and the name Jaheira.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting speak with dead on a corpse that fell from a platform above

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue with tollhouse worker, initiated when talking to corpse that has fallen down cliffside outside tollhouse. There is a key near the corpse that can be found through perception check or in this dialogue.

session_synopses.PAD: The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.
session_synopses.DeadDrow1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the drow raiders. He was killed by a Flaming Fist archer perched atop the inn.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse after casting a speak with dead spell on it

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue initiated when speaking to the decomposing corpse of a toll collector found in an abandoned tollhouse basement

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

session_synopses.Dead_PostEA: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: We shouldn't stay too long. The goblins might come back.
AwayFromCorpse.context: NodeContext: He's politely telling the player to go away.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: A massacre. Drow and goblins slaughtered them all.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: You should talk to Gauntlet Dain. She's in charge.

session_synopses.AwayFromCorpse: A Flaming Fist soldier standing in the aftermath of a drow raid on an inn. There were many casualties, and it's hitting him hard.

Permitted.speaker: Salazon
Permitted.text: Said you could pass, didn't I?
Permitted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Salazon is crouching behind shelves, focused on the entrance. Impatient, wanting to get back to his taskNodeContext: Salazon is crouching behind shelves, focused on the entrance. Impatient, wanting to get back to his task

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: He of the Unsleeping Eyes. Grant me the might to carry this burden. Grant me the faith to face darkness without fear.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek, prayingNodeContext: Quietly praying

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Looks like he wasn't cut out for this line of work.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: Only a coward would speak ill of the fallen.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead JacekNodeContext: Angered by your reaction.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: Would that the arrow had pierced your heart instead.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead JacekNodeContext: Bitter

session_synopses: Flaming Fist praying over a dead colleague. Jacek = "YAHT-sick."Drow players: Ephren believes you are another attacker, and either initiates attack or you persuade her not to.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

Zhent04_AD_Idle.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle.text: Wonder if the Fist pay better than this lot...

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.text: Wait! They've got oil everywhere - and bloody torches!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I'm told we're taking a stroll through the Underdark once we blow the charges.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Let me guess. You'd rather take the surface.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: The route with fewer hook horrors and other beasties? Perish the thought.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: How did a coward like you survive all these years in the Network?

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Dog_03.speaker: Istor
Dog_03.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent07_AD_Combat.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_Combat.text: We've buried tougher than you. Come on!
Zhent07_AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: A threat shouted during combat.

Zhent06_AD_Combat.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_Combat.text: You've messed up. At least you won't live to regret it!

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

Zhent02_Dead.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Dead.text: ... Underdark... trading route... and graveyard both...

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.text: Shitting hells, will this never end?!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been freed by the player, He is leaving the cave, but on the path he feels threatened by something

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Our visitor's taking out the lights! Fall back!

AD_InvestigationCheck2.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck2.text: Locked. Best find another way in.

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: Wouldn't linger down here, I were you - see all that smokepowder?

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: The Flaming Fist won't find nothing here but rubble.

Zhent01_AD_Idle.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: Bored with his menial task.

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Idle: Garias is talking to his brother as they prepare to leave their secret gang hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives: The doubting artist warns the player about the explosives inside the Zhent dungeon
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking her turn.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking his turn.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Dead: A SwD with Zarys, the Zhentarim leader. She can tell us about the situation in the outpost, and the missing agents and cargo she's waiting for.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.VB_Cellar: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck2: Player passes investigation check to discover hidden door, but it's locked.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.
session_synopses.Zhent08: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.
session_synopses.Zhent01_AD_Idle: Salazon is pacing, packing up ahead of the plan to blow the hideout.

PAD_GnollsDead.speaker: Player
PAD_GnollsDead.text: Whatever killed those gnolls might be nearby. Careful.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Cut it out. There's worse than gnolls out there.
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: admonishing a companion, but in a friendly way

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: Nothing we need to worry about.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: How about a dragon? Would that worry you?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: trying to get a rise out of a companion

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: I'd give it a bloody good fight, that's for sure.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Ha! Only thing you'd give a dragon is bad gas.

session_synopses.PAD_GnollsDead: Player comment spoken when seeing a pack of dead gnolls
session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Dialogue between two refugees who are secretly cultists of Zariel. This dialogue is spoken before the player enters the tollhouse where they are hiding out. If a player enters during the dialogue, they stop talking to address the newcomer.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Sarth Baretha, a mid-ranking githyanki warriorv who was ordered to search Faerûn for a mysterious stolen weapon.

PAD_FoundChest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundChest.text: Looks like there's a chest buried in that hay.

Freed.speaker: Benryn
Freed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks around at the wreckage and the bodies.NodeContext: Initially in shock, before the thought of his wife breaks him out of it.

Freed.speaker: Player
Freed.text: Miri? Who are you looking for?

Freed.speaker: Benryn
Freed.text: My wife. She was outside when the goblins came.

Freed.speaker: Benryn
Freed.text: She was wearing a green blouse. Brown hair, about this tall.
Freed.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds his hand about the same height as himself.

Freed.speaker: Player
Freed.text: Sorry, I haven't. But I can look for her.

Freed.speaker: Benryn
Freed.text: Thank you. She can't have gone far.

PAD_Door.speaker: Player
PAD_Door.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

AD_FoundWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_FoundWife.context: NodeContext: Benryn has found his wife's body. He's absolutely devastated - he was afraid she had been killed, but he was holding out hope.

session_synopses.AD_Rescued: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundChest: An AD that plays when you notice the dowry in the stack of hay.
session_synopses.AD_Escaping: This AD plays after Benryn has been rescued and has subsequently joined the party. They are within a  burning building. Once players safely exit the building, Benryn leaves the party and further dialogues become available.In this dialogue, Benryn is
session_synopses.Freed:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.
session_synopses.AD_FoundWife: Benryn has been freed from a burning inn after becoming trapped during a drow/goblin attack. He's just found his wife's body. He'd been holding out hope that she was still alive.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: Still warm to the touch, if you can believe it.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: A dragon is clearly not to be trifled with.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.
